TextView.android:text: Risk Factors

This chart uses conditions and observations from FHIR to determine which risk factors a patient has for certain diseases. The more risk factors a patient has (combined with certain risks having more weight) the higher the risk factor. The risk factor is displayed as a percentage, where higher percentages indicate higher risk.

This chart displays the patient's vital measurements as compared to generally accepted normal ranges for those vitals. The scale is from 1 to 10 with higher numbers indicating higher measurements. The normal ranges are graphed as well, with the patient's measurements overlaid as a comparison.
My current Body Weight is:
Body weight is a measure of your body's weight.
My current BMI is:

Body mass index or BMI, is a ratio of weight to height used to broadly define a 'healthy weight'. A BMI of 25 is considered healthy, while a BMI of less than 15 is considered underweight and a BMI of greater than 25 is considered overweight.
My current Body Height is:
Body height is a measure of your body's height.
My current Body temperature is:
Body temperature is a measure of your body's temperature. 98.6 degrees Farenheit is considered average.
My current Diastolic blood pressure is:

The diastolic blood pressure number or the bottom number indicates the pressure in the arteries when the heart rests between beats. A normal diastolic blood pressure number is less than 80. A diastolic blood pressure between 80 and 89 indicates prehypertension.
My current Systolic blood pressure is:
Heart rate is a count of heart beats per minute. Resting heart rates vary by age, but can be an indicator of good heart health. For your age, a rate of X is considered healthy.
My current Heart rate is:
The systolic blood pressure number or the top number indicates the pressure in the arteries when the heart contracts. A normal systolic blood pressure number is less than 120.
My current Respiratory rate is:
Respatory rate is...
My current Body Weight is:

Essential hypertension is high blood pressure that doesn't have a known secondary cause. It is also referred to as primary hypertension. Blood pressure is the force of blood against your artery walls as your heart pumps blood through your body.
My current Body Weight is:
Dizziness is the feeling of being lightheaded, woozy, or unbalanced.
My current Body Weight is:

Lightheadedness is feeling as if you might faint. Your body may feel heavy while your head feels as if it is not getting enough blood. Another way to describe lightheadedness is as a “reeling sensation.” Lightheadedness may be accompanied by clouded vision and a loss of balance.
My current Body Weight is:
Cluster, migraine and tension-type headaches may produce a headache that awakens an individual in the early morning hours (usually after 4 AM), or is present upon awakening.
